column1: Itarsi is a city and municipality in Madhya Pradesh
column2: India  in Hoshangabad District. Itarsi is a key hub for agricultural goods and is the biggest  railway junction in Madhya Pradesh. Rail services from all 4 major metropolitan cities of India namely Mumbai to Calcutta and Delhi to Chennai pass through Itarsi.Itarsi has large number of agro-based industries and warehouses . Itarsi got its name by "eeta(eent)"
column4: (literally means rope in Hindi). Bricks and ropes had been made earlier in itarsi. It has Ordnance Factory. The Bori Wildlife Sanctuary and Tawa Dam are nearby.Nearest airport Bhopal.

column1: Itarsi is located at 22.62°N 77.75°E﻿ / 22.62; 77.75. It has an average elevation of 304 metres (997 feet).
Itarsi is a sub district in the Hoshangabad district
column2: in the state of Madhya Pradesh. The total population in Itarsi sub district is 240
column3: 719 as per the survey of census during 2011 by Indian Government.

column2: 325 people are living in the urban (towns and cities) area and about 117
297 House Holds in this sub district.

column1: Itarsi also have Indian Ordinance Factory.

column3: 495. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Itarsi has an average literacy rate of 75%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 81% and female literacy is 69%. In Itarsi
column5: 13% of the population is under 6 years of age.Itarsi comes under "Constituents of Urban Agglomerations of Madhya Pradesh" includes Itarsi (M)

column1: The city is a Tehsil under Hoshangabad District. It is a part of Hoshangabad Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) & comes under Hoshangabad - Narsinghpur Loksabha (Parliament) constituency.
It has a municipality with 32 wards and headed by a municipality chairperson.
Itarsi is one of the biggest railway junction in Madhya Pradesh
column3: at the crossing of important east-west and north-south routes. Itarsi comes under West Central Railway zone whose headquarters is in Jabalpur. Itarsi is connected via broad gauge lines to Bhopal and Delhi to the north
column4: Bhusawal and Mumbai to the west
column5: the railway junctions of Nagpur to the south and Jabalpur to the east. Rail services from Mumbai to Guwahati and Delhi to Chennai pass through Itarsi.

column1: 250 trains are daily passing through. Itarsi runs one express train — Vindhyachal express — and it runs three passenger trains in Jabalpur route daily. Itarsi is the busy railway station in Bhopal division. The new platforms 6 and 7 opened for Jabalpur

column2: National Highway (NH-69) connects Itarsi to major cities Bhopal and Nagpur.

column1: New Four lane roads are under the making in to be functional under 5 years. Four Duronto Express trains have technical halts at Itarsi.
Under construction project -  * Itarsi-Bhusawal 3rd line. * Itarsi-nagpur 3rd line(Central Railway pushes Rs 140cr third line project in ghat section). * Itarsi-bhopal 3rd line. *
